p: In another study, the effect of aqueous leaf extracts of miracle fruit on 2-aminoanthracene (2-AA) and 4-nitroquinoline-N-oxide (4-NQO)-induced mutation and oxidative damage was evaluated ( Chen et al., 2015). The leaf extracts caused concentration-dependent inhibition of the mutagenicity of 2-AA (an indirect mutagen) and 4-NQO (a direct mutagen) toward Salmonella typhimurium TA 98 and TA 100. The antimutagenic activity was attributed to the phenolic constituents of S. dulcificum leaf compounds. Active phenolics present in the sample include p-hydroxybenzoic acid, vanillic acid, syringic acid, trans-p-coumaric acid, and veratric acid.
